grammar.title: Present Perfect Simple vs Past Simple

section.title: Present Perfect Simple vs Past Simple
section.sectiontitle: Use the Present Perfect Simple to describe an action that started in the past and continues in the present (unfinished time) or happened in the past but has a result in the present (present result)
section.text1a: I have known her since I was a child.
section.text2a: Juan has left his umbrella at home.
section.sectiontitle2: Use the Past Simple to talk about something that happened at a specific time (details)
